vision.notes: Winged forms possess compound eyes and ocelli (simple eyes). Wingless forms lack eyes and ocelli.

mechanoreception.notes: Presence of nine-segmented moniliform (beaded) antennae suggests mechanoreceptive capabilities for detecting vibrations or physical contact. Mouthparts adapted for chewing.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely present, as it is common in insects for finding food and mates, but not explicitly mentioned.
